meanings.definition: Make (a substance) soluble, especially by the action of a solvent.
meanings.sent1: I can solubilise sugar in water to make a sweet solution.
meanings.sent2: Chemists often solubilise compounds to study their properties.
meanings.sent3: Trying to solubilise a rock in lemonade would be quite a strange experiment.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness seemed to solubilise the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The warm water helped solubilise the detergent, creating a soapy mixture.
